page.title: 09PETERHEAD PRISON
page.content: Peterhead Prison at Invernettie was opened in 1888. From the opening of the prison, until about 1955, a large party of prisoners was conveyed each weekday by private railway to a quarry at Stirling Hill.Here they excavated and dressed granite required for building the Harbour of Refuge. Nowadays, however, convicts are employed in worksheds practising skills they might require in industry when liberated. Plans have been passed to build a new prison in the near future on the same grounds.At the moment, there are approximately 200 inmates accommodated in this maximum security prison.
